Text:
The best part of my job is traveling around the state and hearing directly from Coloradans about their lives, their families, and their communities. I can’t wait to get on the road again in 2023.

Happy New Year! https://t.co/e3aeXO5jrp

A year ago, thousands of families lost their homes in the most devastating fire in Colorado’s history. 

We’re urging insurance companies to keep supporting these families as they continue to rebuild from the #MarshallFire.
https://t.co/Z4V2vv777A

Thanks to the CHIPS and Science Act, we’re investing in American manufacturing again and bringing good-paying jobs home.
https://t.co/s4wGsrPJRo

Our country faces a gun violence epidemic that no other country in the world faces.

This year, Congress finally overcame the NRA to pass the first federal gun safety bill in decades.

It was a significant start, but there’s more to do to #EndGunViolence.
https://t.co/ylQyLHcQTf

This year, we made the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline more accessible to those in need of help.

If you are in need of immediate support, help is available. 

Dial the new lifeline at 988.
https://t.co/l3uNYtBYiF

The Inflation Reduction Act was a win for the American people over Big Pharma.

And in just a few days, seniors won’t have to pay more than $35/month for their insulin. 
https://t.co/lkxMS1seeG

We preserved both painful and inspiring parts of Colorado’s history by protecting Camp Amache and Camp Hale with national designations, ensuring that future generations will be able to learn and grow from our past. https://t.co/SsRO6Rcr1y

In September, I flew over the Colorado River with @DepSecBeaudreau and @USBR Commissioner Touton to show them how Coloradans are grappling with less water.

The $4 billion we secured in the Inflation Reduction Act for Western Drought is a great start, but there’s more work to do. https://t.co/NgK3ADnDGe

There may be no right closer to the heart than marrying the one that you love.

When we passed the Respect for Marriage Act this month, we moved our country closer to our highest ideals and took a historic step toward equality.
https://t.co/qSPuf2usr9

In March, I joined @FLOTUS & @SecBecerra to talk about how broadband funding in the Infrastructure Law will help close the digital divide for Latinos in CO.

We need to ensure that Latino students, businesses & patients have access to the 21st century digital tools they need.

After years of environmental hardships, the $350M we secured for the South Platte River will help build resilient infrastructure in Denver.

This funding from the Infrastructure Law will protect communities, support recreation, and improve water quality.  
https://t.co/7KwXESVeMy

Coloradans rely on @USPS for the timely delivery of mail, bills, and medications – but for years, they’ve faced delays.

Congress finally passed the Postal Service Reform Act to improve USPS’ financial stability and prioritize service for all Coloradans.
https://t.co/Gi9f7bD3H3

Our veterans earned and deserve the highest quality health care.

After years of inaction from Washington, I voted to pass the PACT Act — the largest expansion of veteran health care benefits in decades. 
https://t.co/cmD56lsUpR

CO families, commuters, & businesses depend on I-70, but for too long Floyd Hill has been a major pain point for travelers.

Thanks to the Infrastructure Law, CO received $100M to improve Floyd Hill and restore this critical gateway to the American West. 
https://t.co/olpVZTUIeW

The American West faces a 1,200 year mega-drought. 

We secured $4 billion in the #InflationReductionAct to confront this crisis and protect our Western way of life. 
https://t.co/LgojO6meYW

While 2023 is just around the corner, I’m still thinking about how much we accomplished in 2022 — from confirming a historic Supreme Court Justice to passing the Electoral Count Reform Act.

Over the next few days, I’ll be recapping the best of 2022 – I hope you follow along. https://t.co/dFeLU7vJRp

We have much to celebrate this year, including how we came together throughout as friends, family, neighbors, and Coloradans demonstrating the resilient spirit of our state.

This holiday season, I’m wishing you and your loved ones warm and happy holidays. https://t.co/fwP12aRvU2

Ed served our state for nearly three decades in the State Capitol and in Washington. He represented the best of Colorado with his thoughtful, collaborative, and joyful approach. Even as he leaves Congress, I know he will continue fighting for Coloradans.
https://t.co/8UfIqGGYlz

For too long, American taxpayers have had to clean up abandoned oil and gas wells in their communities. 

I’m urging @Interior to hold corporations — not taxpayers — responsible for the costs of cleaning up their wells on public lands.
https://t.co/tPwoOVRDxf

✔️ Improving our water infrastructure in southern CO 
✔️ Increasing affordable housing on the Western Slope
✔️ Investing in minority-owned businesses along the Front Range

We secured nearly $200 million for projects across Colorado ↓
https://t.co/cBEEp4cqrd

President @ZelenskyyUA’s address tonight was a rousing call to defend freedom and democracy from tyranny. 

America stands with Ukraine.

Tomorrow could be Colorado’s coldest day in over 30 years.

Stay inside if possible, and be prepared. Learn more ↓
https://t.co/XAKssDD26c

I’m grateful to the bipartisan committee that showed that no one is above the law – not even a former president.
https://t.co/z2iGXPLHlX

Congress has a responsibility to save our family farms and ranches, fix our broken immigration system, secure our nation’s food supply, and lower costs for American families.

This is a matter of economic, food, and national security. We can't let politics stop us from acting. https://t.co/wGcNbRUtMB

GOP leaders sent a lump of coal to America’s children this year — they refused to even discuss a deal for kids and businesses.

I will continue to oppose cutting taxes for corporations without passing an expanded Child Tax Credit. https://t.co/yNyV0n8S6G

WATCH: We don’t have to accept crushing food prices, losing America’s family farms, and hundreds of thousands living in the shadows.

I’m speaking on the Senate floor to urge my colleagues to pass my #AffordableAndSecureFoodAct. https://t.co/irUcvmVwBd

I’ve heard from Coloradans like Bill for years about the importance of protecting the Thompson Divide from further oil and gas leasing.

I'm grateful @POTUS initiated a mineral withdrawal in October and thrilled to see the process to finalize it underway.
https://t.co/91RKYpWMpr

We have seen how hateful rhetoric can rob from us our loved ones and forever change our communities.

We must stand up for our LGBTQ neighbors and speak loudly against those who want to divide us.
https://t.co/Ed8ekNlQb5

La escasez de campesinos aumenta costos y restringe presupuestos familiares, forzando decisiones entre alimentos, medicinas y vivienda.

El congreso debe avanzar mi  #AffordableAndSecureFoodAct apoyado por agricultores, campesinos, defensores de la inmigración y empresarios.

The National Mall has been the site of historic calls for progress for generations.

This monument honors our nation’s long journey toward equality and deserves this most dignified location in both our nation’s capital and our nation’s history. 
https://t.co/vMxrXvDwYf

Last week, my colleagues and I urged @POTUS to create a task force and national strategy to combat antisemitism. I’m glad to see his support for our recommendations.

We must stand up against religious intolerance and hatred.
https://t.co/QBym4JWGLI
We won't cut taxes for corporations without cutting taxes for kids—this Congress or next Congress. https://t.co/15WvdZk5nt

When I talk to family farmers & ranchers across Colorado, I hear about our need to pass immigration reform to meet our agricultural labor needs.

My #AffordableAndSecureFoodAct is a compromise to lower food costs for consumers & labor costs for producers.
https://t.co/kOgg0TnjSG

The acquisition of the Latham property gives Coloradans better access to public lands, expands recreational opportunities, and protects our natural resources.

I fought to fully fund the Land and Water Conservation Fund to make these exact types of investments.

This breakthrough is a powerful testament to American science, engineering, and dedication to push the frontiers of human discovery.

Although the promise of fusion energy remains far off, we just took one historic step forward.
https://t.co/H1v3YzNTjt

We need to make it easier for family farmers and ranchers across Colorado to continue to grow the safest food supply in the world.

My #AffordableAndSecureFoodAct creates a path to legal status for undocumented farm workers, drives down costs for producers and lowers food prices. https://t.co/l8vw4iNNg5

This is a little hard to comprehend from the same editorial board that supported Trump's tax giveaways – 52% of which went to the top 5%.

In a country with the 4th highest child poverty rate in the industrialized world, why are you fighting so hard to keep children poor?

It's past time for immigration reform to grow our economy and help farmers and farm workers.

My #AffordableAndSecureFoodAct will
🛒Lower food costs for families
🚜 Reduce labor costs for farmers and ranchers
👨🌾 Provide a pathway to legal status for undocumented farm workers https://t.co/fPys3m2TXT

HAPPENING NOW: I'm standing with farmers and farm workers to talk about our plan to lower food costs for families, reduce labor costs for growers, and bring certainty to undocumented farm workers. Watch here ➡️ https://t.co/UWVjsdkFij

A decade ago, 20 children & 6 educators were killed at Sandy Hook with an AR-15. There have been almost 30 mass shootings at schools since then. 

Our kids deserve to feel safe in the classroom. We must act to get these weapons of war off our streets.
https://t.co/6czItdvbhA

We are witnessing a rise in extremist attacks in CO & across the country.

I’m grateful to Club Q survivors Michael Anderson and James Slaugh, and co-owner Matthew Haynes for having the strength to testify on this alarming trend & the need for safe spaces for LGBTQ communities.

The Respect for Marriage Act moves us closer to fulfilling our nation’s highest ideals of equality for all. 

It was a remarkable day at the White House as @POTUS signed this historic legislation. https://t.co/4H09KE5IBy

Our democracy depends on the peaceful and orderly transfer of power, but we have to fix loopholes in existing law that allow reckless politicians to destabilize the process.

We have to pass the Electoral Count Reform Act before the end of the year.

Judge Gordon Gallagher has proven his integrity & legal acumen over his 25-year career. He brings perspective from the West Slope & experience working with Tribal communities.

Watch as I speak before the Judiciary Committee to support his nomination for U.S. District Court. ⬇️ https://t.co/l4d4ikwqLG

That isn't the America I grew up in. My daughters’ generation bears the burden of gun violence I never did — that they could be killed in their classrooms, places of worship, or grocery stores.

We have so much left to do to give our children the safe future that they deserve.

The child tax credit worked.

We need to put working people first and extend this lifeline for Coloradan families. https://t.co/zuopjpDzBl

The rural clean energy investments I helped secure in the #InflationReductionAct will help boost clean energy deployment, cut emissions, create jobs, & lower costs for rural families.

USDA should distribute funds swiftly, in innovative, flexible ways. We have no time to waste.

Susan and I stopped by Laura Menorah's "Saturday Serve" Drag Brunch to benefit the Club Q community.

Let's continue to uplift, celebrate, and stand up with our LGBTQ+ community. https://t.co/zDO5rCkSUh

Coloradans can still shop for health insurance, change plans, and find coverage that will start at the beginning of 2023.

Find affordable coverage for you and your family through the marketplace today ⬇️
https://t.co/yWg8Xwtdzh https://t.co/VJqYCEEIFp

Our state is preparing to roll out historic funding to close the digital divide thanks to my BRIDGE Act and the Infrastructure Law.

Help Colorado get its full funding by reporting if your address lacks broadband service at https://t.co/VE36HbDEHg.
https://t.co/HtP4cPsWde

In the richest country in the world, everyone should have access to high-speed internet.

This initial $5M investment will strengthen CO's ability to plan for broadband funding next year and maximize this once-in-a-generation opportunity for our state.
https://t.co/4hS0d6AiKm

No parent in America should worry about the water their kids drink.

@DenverWater received $76M from the Infrastructure Law to meet its commitment to replace every customer-owned lead pipe & prioritize underserved neighborhoods — showing the rest of the country what’s possible. https://t.co/8ziwyQ9wVa
Congratulations to my friends @SenatorHick and Robin on this wonderful news.

As communities across Colorado face drought and a changing climate, the San Luis Valley can lead the way in our transition to a clean energy economy by harnessing the power of solar on our farms and ranches.
https://t.co/tqdtcnVsXM

Latina Equal Pay Day reminds us that Latina women help fuel our economy but earn 54 cents for every dollar earned by their white male coworkers.

We must pass the Paycheck Fairness Act and ensure everyone earns a fair wage for equal work. #LatinaEqualPay

We can’t allow anti-democratic forces to exploit ambiguities in our laws to undermine our elections and the will of the American people.

We need to pass the Electoral Count Reform Act before the end of the year.

81 years ago, the attack on Pearl Harbor changed the course of history. 

Our country will be forever indebted to the servicemembers who gave their life on that day. May we continue to honor their memory.
Before Congress goes home, we need to pass an expanded Child Tax Credit once again — the biggest tax cut for working people in American history. https://t.co/Kq1exh2VQo

We should have never let the Child Tax Credit expire and should not cut taxes for corporations without cutting them for families.

We’re calling on Congress to reinstate this lifeline before the end of the year. #CTCNow

Colorado and the West face the driest conditions in over 1,200 years.

Along with @SenatorRomney and fourteen of my colleagues, we’re urging @USDA to prioritize this water crisis and help farmers, ranchers, and the American West. https://t.co/FyPiTXPArj

Today, Congress honored the @CapitolPolice officers who protected the Capitol during the violent insurrection on Jan. 6, 2021.

On behalf of CO & our nation, I express my sincere gratitude to them & their families for their sacrifice, service, & valiant defense of our democracy.

Permitting delays hold us back from connecting communities across the country to the high-speed internet they need to work, learn, and stay connected.

I joined @SenatorHick in calling to cut red tape & make it easier to build 21st century infrastructure.
https://t.co/NyYozlIagI

Club Q was a safe space, built over two decades, where everyone belonged. It was a second home for many in the community.

Yesterday, I visited the Club Q memorial in Colorado Springs to pay my respects to the victims and survivors of this horrific attack. https://t.co/OUEIidzOa3

During the pandemic, I proposed the Health Force to support our nation’s under-resourced public health workforce.

Thanks to the $3B I secured in the American Rescue Plan, Colorado is receiving $51M to train public health workers and invest in the health of our communities.

Denver Water has set the example for water providers working with homeowners to replace harmful lead pipes.

My FLOW Act builds on Denver's experience to reduce the financial burden that homeowners face and extends safe drinking water to every household.
https://t.co/RQTqxSpKrc

Like many other Coloradans, I firmly believe that our LGBTQ community deserves to live without fear. 

My office has put together resources to help our entire Colorado community grieve and process the tragedy at Club Q ⬇️
https://t.co/XyXvOKpNBb

Congratulations to @USMNT and Colorado’s own goalkeeper Ethan Horvath on advancing to the knockout stages of the World Cup. 

Best of luck against the Netherlands today! I believe that we will win. #OnlyForward #SoloPalante

With this funding, the Southern Ute Indian Tribe can bring their families, farms, businesses, and schools online, help communities within the reservation boundaries improve their broadband services, and begin to close the digital divide.
https://t.co/kIisrLMBdw

Amidst supply chain disruptions & labor shortages, additional tariffs are the last thing CO’s solar industry needs. I’ll keep working to find a path forward that protects our solar companies while boosting US manufacturing and holding China accountable.
https://t.co/IfqxfrdPwP

The FTX fiasco proves that we need strong regulation to protect consumers while keeping the broader economy insulated from this volatile sector.
https://t.co/TqbHv2mmCi

The @988Lifeline is experiencing a nationwide service interruption affecting calls but not texts or online support.

If you're looking for help or someone to talk to, you can still text 988 or chat online: https://t.co/9FPpMVA8yY

The Dolores River is vital to Southwest Colorado. I spoke today before the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources to advocate for this thoughtful compromise written and supported by Coloradans to manage and preserve the river for the next generation. https://t.co/LgWuP2i2XB

Glad to see this proposal to cut methane pollution on public lands. It will help safeguard our climate, clean our air, protect our environment, and save valuable energy resources. I urge @BLMNational to finalize a strong rule that follows Colorado’s lead.
https://t.co/sUWCWq7Xu8

It's unacceptable that Native women earn 51 cents for every dollar their white male colleagues make.

#NativeWomensEqualPay Day is an urgent call to action to end the wage gap — which we can do by passing the Paycheck Fairness Act & ensuring women are paid fairly for their work.
BREAKING: The Senate just passed the Respect for Marriage Act — a historic step toward realizing the promise of equality for LGBTQ people around the country. https://t.co/dcFLDC3B3s
I’m headed down to the Senate floor to honor the lives lost in the #ClubQ attack and push for swift passage of the Respect for Marriage Act. Watch here➡️ https://t.co/Fu4Fjx7J4t

The Sand Creek Massacre stole a generation from the Cheyenne and Arapaho people and left a wound that Native people carry to this day.

It is our duty to recognize today's solemn anniversary so that every American can come to understand this horrendous part of our history. https://t.co/F5LpgR8ANw

Over the next few weeks, Congress has the opportunity to reinstate the expanded Child Tax Credit that cut childhood poverty almost in half. It’s the right thing to do, and it’s time we prioritize America’s kids over big corporations.
https://t.co/z1yywU4faS

Last week’s horrific attack on Colorado’s LGBTQ community underscores the need to fight homophobia, transphobia, and hate.
 
This week, I’ll vote to pass the Respect for Marriage Act, a long-overdue step toward fulfilling our nation's highest ideals.

Now through December 15th, Coloradans can shop for health insurance, change plans, and find coverage that will start at the beginning of 2023.

See if your family qualifies for tax credits to access health insurance during Open Enrollment today ⬇️
https://t.co/yWg8XwsFJJ

It’s heartbreaking to mark the anniversary of one shooting just days after that same community suffered another.

Today, we remember the lives lost and families forever changed by the 2015 Colorado Springs Planned Parenthood shooting. We cannot accept this violence as normal.

An expanded and fully refundable Child Tax Credit means getting help directly to the families that need it.

To meet the rising costs of childcare, housing, and food, we must extend the CTC again before the end of the year.
https://t.co/u2To5P6t2u
Accounting for 99.5% of all businesses in our state, small businesses power Colorado’s economy. Celebrate Small Business Saturday today by visiting your local bookstore, coffee shop, or retailer.

The people of Colorado Springs will not let hate win.
https://t.co/8zOy02JrUD
On this Native American Heritage Day, let’s pause to acknowledge the contributions and sacrifices of the generations of Indigenous people who preceded us as well as those who will follow.
The Colorado River Compact was agreed to one hundred years ago. Today, we must mark its centennial with a renewed urgency to collaborate and protect the Colorado River.

This year, I’m grateful for Colorado’s resilience. Even in our most difficult moments, the outpouring of support and love from across the state reminds me of our community’s unwavering strength.

From my family to yours, Happy Thanksgiving.

As you plan on visiting family over the holidays, please remember to stay home if you’re sick and take reasonable precautions to keep your loved ones safe.
https://t.co/p1g4SaEgIr

If you need mental health or emotional support in the wake of the Club Q shooting, Colorado Crisis Services are available around the clock: call 844-493-TALK, text TALK to 38255, or visit https://t.co/6h8Gxqluwp.

If you want to help the survivors and families of the victims of the Club Q shooting rebuild after this unimaginable tragedy, please direct your support to these organizations, which are directly helping those involved:
https://t.co/9zXEB59iRS

As local and national law enforcement seek justice in the Colorado Springs shooting, they urge anyone with information about the incident or with photographic evidence to please come forward by safely and securely calling 1-800-CALL-FBI or going online:
https://t.co/DT0RKiL3m7

Colorado mourns the loss of five members of our community:

Daniel Davis Aston
Derrick Rump
Kelly Loving
Ashley Paugh
Raymond Green Vance

May we honor them as they lived, with grace and pride.
https://t.co/yIPiurk49M

I am so grateful for the bravery of the Coloradans who fought back and saved the lives of those inside Club Q.
https://t.co/pptWNSLDox

Club Q was a place of joy, acceptance, and community. That has been shattered by yet another incident of gun violence.

I didn't grow up in a country where mass gun violence was normal, and the next generation of Americans shouldn't have to either.
https://t.co/iMMAkwNXgb
As we seek justice for this unimaginable act, we must do more to protect the LGBTQ community and stand firm against discrimination and hate in every form.

I’m devastated to hear about the shooting in Colorado Springs that cut five more lives tragically short. I’m thinking of their families and loved ones, and sending strength to those who were injured, the survivors, and Colorado’s LGBTQ community.

Every week, I send out a newsletter with what my office has been working on to help Coloradans and advance your priorities. 

Sign up today to hear about how I’m delivering for Colorado ⬇️
https://t.co/cW0ND6uWnh

Veterans and their families are eligible for a new lifetime pass to more than 2,000 sites from @NatlParkService, @USFWS, @USBR, @ForestService, @BLMNational, and more. If you're a veteran, you can secure your pass in person or online today.

More info ⬇️
https://t.co/QxnSe0VCFE

As we celebrate National Native American Heritage Month, we must do more than highlight the cultural contributions of Tribal communities. We also must reaffirm our commitment and obligation to support Indigenous peoples in Colorado and nationwide.
https://t.co/ghhQaRXjvu

We have the tools to stay healthy over the holidays - and with vaccines available as close as your local pharmacy, there’s no reason to put yourself, your kids, or your loved ones at risk.
https://t.co/HhoxKkRxnP

As Colorado experiences a growing mental health crisis, I just introduced a bill with @RepBrendanBoyle and @RepShontelBrown that would empower mental and physical health providers to work together to treat patients holistically.
https://t.co/UAranGPPac

For 35 years, @SpeakerPelosi has served as a dedicated public servant, master legislator, and historic Speaker of the House. She wasn’t in this for herself or for the power — she was in it to make America a better place, especially for our children.

Thank you, Madam Speaker.

Veterans should have convenient and easy access to the benefits they’ve earned.

I'm introducing the GUARD VA Benefits Act to protect veterans and hold bad actors accountable for predatory financial practices. 
https://t.co/iPnVadHbrn

Congratulations to all who made this possible — especially Colorado’s aerospace industry and academic communities for their critical contributions. The U.S. must sustain its role as a space innovation leader, and I'll continue to work with my Senate colleagues to ensure we do.

In 2017, large companies received a tax break worth over $49B. Now, corporate lobbyists are fighting to extend it.

We have to fight for working families by saying no to new tax breaks for billion-dollar corporations until we expand the Child Tax Credit.
https://t.co/uNh8riNLWy

A year ago, @POTUS signed the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law — a once-in-a-generation investment in America's future.

This legislation has already delivered to rebuild our highways, invest in clean energy, protect our forests, and bring internet to Coloradans across the state.

Coloradans have until tomorrow to claim their expanded #ChildTaxCredit. This crucial support helped cut childhood poverty almost in half and has helped families pay bills & put food on the table.

If you haven’t received your credit, file for it today ⬇️
https://t.co/JGKhfzKQcX
Heading back to Washington with my friends and colleagues @RepJoeNeguse, @RepJasonCrow, and @RepCarbajal to deliver for Colorado and the West. https://t.co/ICHHk4UFYi

Congratulations to @aurorak12’s Jimmy Day, Colorado’s 2023 Teacher of the Year. Jimmy goes above and beyond to share music with his students. During American Education Week, let's celebrate the many educators who give their all for our children.
https://t.co/h3hmmGjRrd

We helped thousands of Coloradans by capping the cost of insulin for seniors at $35/month in the Inflation Reduction Act.

This National Diabetes Month, let’s cap the cost of this lifesaving medicine for every American.

For some returning servicemembers, the transition back to civilian life can be difficult—that's why I supported designating Warrior Call Day to highlight our duty to care for our veterans.

Today, take a moment to check in on a veteran in your community. One call can save a life.

CO led the nation in cutting harmful methane pollution that is among the biggest contributors to climate change. I welcome these stronger standards to clean up our air & safeguard our climate and urge @EPA to finalize rules that follow our state’s example.
https://t.co/NTMzTFWzrd

The Colorado River Basin is home to four endangered fish species that deserve protection. Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Colorado is receiving $6.4M to protect these species on the Upper Colorado River.

No kid should go hungry, especially in the wealthiest country in the world. Coloradans are leading the way by ensuring that every student has access to free and healthy school meals. 
https://t.co/7pI6WzZtY0

Veterans Day is an opportunity to honor the service and sacrifice of generations of servicemembers who have defended our freedoms. Today, we affirm our support for our nation’s veterans and their families.

Survivors of natural disasters like the Marshall Fire have enough to worry about without fees to replace passports and other vital documents. My REPLACE Act would waive these fees to help Coloradans get back on their feet.
https://t.co/grYDlrJZh0

Denver’s STAR program is a national model for supporting law enforcement with a more comprehensive approach, including mental health. I’m glad to see the program expand its scope and partner with @serviciosdlraza.
https://t.co/QZYuCgDo4H

I'm grateful for the opportunity to serve Colorado for another term.

I'm getting back to work today. 

To end childhood poverty. 

Protect the right to choose. 

Defend our democracy.

And build an economy that works for everyone, not just those at the top.
In June, the Supreme Court struck down the fundamental right to reproductive health care. We have to keep fighting to codify the right to choose into law.

Washington spent 40 years cutting taxes for the wealthiest people and corporations as income inequality skyrocketed. We began to turn the page with the expanded CTC and EITC — the two largest tax cuts for working people in a generation. We have to make them permanent.
For decades, special interests have kept us from requiring Medicare to negotiate lower drug prices for the American people. In the Inflation Reduction Act, we overcame Big Pharma and got it done.
Social Security is a commitment we make to every American after a lifetime of work. We have to protect this vital program for our seniors, people with disabilities, and the next generation.

With flu season in full swing, it’s never been a better time to get your yearly flu shot and protect yourself and your family.

Find more information here:
https://t.co/kGTB0tUqpS

Our servicemembers' families make incredible sacrifices to support their loved ones who answer the call.

Veterans & Military Family Month is an opportunity to recognize all they do for our country and reaffirm our commitment to supporting them.

In the last few years, Colorado has endured some of the most destructive wildfires on record. I secured funding to invest in our forests & now I’m asking @forestservice for their plan to use these funds to address the West's wildfire crisis.
https://t.co/HUzf8ESj5v

For too long, we invested everywhere but here in America. But now, thanks to the Infrastructure Law, we’re finally rebuilding our country and working to leave more opportunity, not less, to the next generation of Coloradans.
https://t.co/klwtsHYt8j

I congratulate Chairman Manuel Heart and Council members Malcolm Lehi, Darwin Whiteman Jr. and Conrad Jacket on their continued leadership of the Ute Mountain Ute Tribe.

I look forward to working with Chairman Heart and the Tribal Council to address their Tribe’s priorities. https://t.co/cvToEP8BUF

Today, family caregivers receive almost no support for their vital role in our families and communities. That's why I introduced the Credit for Caring Act to ease the financial burden of caregiving. #NFCMonth

Dearfield was Colorado's largest black homesteading settlement. In September, @SenatorHick and I introduced legislation to take the first step toward preserving this historic site, and now we're calling for a hearing on our bill.
https://t.co/2UFZSQOwKN

The last few years have made clear the importance of addressing inequities in the public health of every community. 

Thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act and American Rescue Plan, Colorado is getting $2.9M to monitor air quality in our communities.

I’m glad diplomatic talks have led to a ceasefire and truce in Ethiopia. This is an important step to end the violence, and I hope it leads to broader national dialogue. We must also continue to ensure that humanitarian aid reaches those in need.
https://t.co/ZYevG4TRHR

As energy prices rise, CO is receiving $64M to help families stay safe & avoid difficult choices between paying energy bills or buying other critical necessities. I’m glad the administration listened to our call to deliver relief to the American people.
https://t.co/v5AgnCksm3

The Child Tax Credit dramatically reduced child poverty and helped families keep up with the cost of living last year.

We shouldn't have allowed it to lapse, and we shouldn't extend corporate tax breaks at the end of the year without also extending the CTC. Read why ⬇️

We have a historic opportunity to invest in our forests with the $10B from the Infrastructure Law and the IRA.

Today was for the 10th Mountain veterans — from WWII to Afghanistan — for whom Camp Hale has become a refuge and a place of peace. With this designation, we offer their service the dignity of public remembrance. https://t.co/OdjodLQva8

With this designation, we offer our veterans the dignity of public remembrance, safeguard this place and its extraordinary history, and ensure that we can share the story of the 10th Mountain and their contributions.

Colorado will be forever grateful.

This proclamation reflects the vision and compromises of local officials, veterans, sportsmen, environmental groups, and so many others. 

The result is a victory for Colorado’s environment, our outdoor economy, and the legacy of public lands we owe the next generation.

After the war, many veterans returned to Colorado to build our ski and outdoor industries. 

Theirs is an extraordinary story - a deeply Colorado story - of service, vision, entrepreneurship, and an abiding connection to the outdoors and our public lands.

In 1945, the skills of 10th Mountain made history at Riva Ridge, where they climbed over 1,800 ft up a vertical cliff in the dead of night to dislodge Axis soldiers from the high ground.

Their heroism helped break the German line and clear the way for Victory in Europe.

It also honors the legacy of the 10th Mountain Division. During World War II, 15K soldiers from across the country came here.

Some had never seen snow or been in the mountains. But over two years of relentless training, they became the world’s most capable mountain soldiers.

Its history goes back to before Colorado was even a state. 
According to the tribal history of the Ute people, their ancestors lived here “since the beginning of time.” This designation honors their enduring connection to the land and their rightful role in helping to manage it.

This is a historic day for Colorado, and I want to thank @GovofCO, @RepJoeNeguse, @SenatorHick, @SecVilsack and so many others for their leadership to make it possible.

This designation means more Americans will come to appreciate the extraordinary history of Camp Hale.
TUNE IN NOW as I join @POTUS in Colorado to officially designate Camp Hale-Continental Divide as our nation’s newest National Monument.

BREAKING: @POTUS will designate Colorado's Camp Hale and the Tenmile range as his first national monument. I can't think of a better choice.
 
This wouldn't have happened without the tireless work of a broad coalition of Coloradans who have fought for these protections for years.

A broad coalition of Coloradans supports making Camp Hale and the Tenmile Range a national monument.

I heard about this case first-hand in Alamosa last year. It is just one example of how Mexican and Spanish communities in Alamosa at the turn of the century fought to move our country closer toward our highest ideals of equality and opportunity for all.

The decision allowed kids to attend the school most convenient to them. 

For years prior, Mexican and Spanish American kids in Alamosa like young Miguel Maestas were required to attend the Mexican Preparatory School even if other schools were closer to their homes.

As #HispanicHeritageMonth comes to a close, I want to highlight Maestas vs George H. Shone — a 1913 landmark school desegregation case in Colorado.

Many experts believe it was the first successful Hispanic desegregation case in the US. https://t.co/DS1D5JcxJ9

Today, RCV is used in some form in 29 states, including Colorado, Maine, and Minnesota. States and cities across the country understand that our political system is desperate for creative reforms to break the partisan fever and make government work again for the American people.

#RankedChoiceVoting is the fastest growing reform in America because it gives people more choices, increases political competition, eliminates costly runoffs, and rewards candidates who appeal to the broadest swath of voters.

Instead of voting for a single candidate, #RCV lets you rank candidates in order of preference. If no candidate wins a majority outright, the last-place candidate is eliminated and you take their voters' next choice into account. Learn more about it here: https://t.co/idn4OMEZoG

They did their duty to our nation, and their example calls on us to do the same -- by learning from the past 20 years, correcting course where we must, and coming together in common purpose.

As we reflect on the past 20 yrs, we must remember the 3,000 Americans lost that terrible morning, along w/ the men & women who gave their lives in Afghanistan & Iraq, our veterans who still bear wounds of war (many, invisible) & first responders who still struggle w/ sickness.

Strategic global leadership became reckless unilateralism and nation-building. Then and now, politicians played to our darkest impulses of fear, hatred, and isolation at the expense of our highest ideals.

The attacks brought out the best in our nation -- courage, resolve, and resilience -- but they also set in motion challenges that remain with us today. Powerful unity gave way to intense partisan division.

On 9/11 2001, terrorists attacked our nation and our democratic way of life. They failed. Twenty years later, America still has the strongest economy in the world, the most capable fighting force ever assembled, and, despite our challenges, the oldest democracy in human history.

America will never heal until we fully confront and dismantle systemic racism in this country. As we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, let’s rise to the example of leaders like Frederick Douglass, Fannie Lou Hamer, and Dr. King by working to make our country what it ought to be.

But this cannot be something we discuss for only one month.
